title: Far-right London rally sees record crowds and violent clashes with police
description: More than 110,000 people join Tommy Robinson-organised protest featuring racist conspiracy theories and hate speech
content:
More than 110,000 people have taken part in a far-right street protest organised by the activist Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, known as Tommy Robinson, in what is thought to be the largest nationalist event in decades.
Marchers travelled to London by train ... [6343 chars]

title: Ukraine drone starts fire at one of Russia’s largest oil plants
description: Head of Bashkortostan region reports second drone shot down and minor damage to Bashneft’s Ufa refinery
content:
A Ukrainian drone has crashed into one of Russia’s largest oil-refining complexes, sparking a fire and causing minor damage, a Russian official has said.
The complex, which belongs to Russian oil company Bashneft, lies on the outskirts of the central... [1252 chars]

title: At least 32 people killed as Israel intensifies airstrikes in Gaza City, medical staff say
description: Israel has in recent days increased its strikes on Gaza City, having ordered residents to leave what it says is Hamas's last stronghold.
content:
A barrage of airstrikes has killed at least 32 people in Gaza City as Israel continued intensifying its offensive there, medical staff have said.
The dead include 12 children, according to the morgue in Shifa Hospital, where the bodies were brought.

title: Man charged over damage to London synagogues
description: The 37-year-old man has been charged with racially or religiously aggravated criminal damage, the Met Police said.
content:
A man has been charged in connection with a series of attacks on synagogues in north-west London.
Ionut-Cristian Bold, 37, of no fixed address, has been charged with six counts of racially or religiously aggravated criminal damage as well as one coun... [597 chars]

title: Tottenham win at London Stadium
description: Three second-half goals condemned West Ham United to a 3-0 home Premier League defeat by Tottenham Hotspur on Saturday.
content:
West Ham United 0-3 Tottenham Hotspur
Premier League, London Stadium, Saturday 13 September 2025, 5.30pm BST
Three second-half goals condemned West Ham United to a 3-0 home Premier League defeat by Tottenham Hotspur on Saturday.
